title: [UWP] touch event bug when pixels ≠ device independent pixels
body: ### Description On UWP, when `scale` = (pixels / device independent pixels) ≠ 1. The Touch event fires within a subset of the View (1/scale in each dimension), but Location reports numbers that are too large, by a factor of `scale`. The possible Location values correctly correspond to the view area in pixels, but they are realized on a subset of the view only. ### Basic Information - Version with issue: 1.60.0 - IDE: VS 15.7.0 - Platform Target Frameworks: UWP (other platforms not tested) - UWP: 16299 ### Screenshots
